Docs.value: The that will be assigned to the 's at the end of deceleration.

remarks.para: When the application user lifts their finger after a dragging gesture, the will typically continue to scroll as it decelerates. The value of this property is the that will be assigned to the 's at the end of deceleration if no intervening events (e.g., another drag) occur and if the application developer does not programmatically assign the . This value incorporates any bouncing/rebounding that may occur during the animation.

Docs.summary: The velocity of the scroll view (in points) when the touch ended.
Docs.value: The velocity of the scroll view (in points) when the touch ended.

remarks.para: This value is small and precisely specified (e.g., [1.19515,0.1240199]). The time units and precision are not documented nor is it documented if they are device-specific.
